    • setAccessPath

      public void setAccessPath(String _accessPath)
      Specifies the path to the Access database file.

      For example: C:/folder/database.accdb

      Parameters:
      _accessPath - path

    • setUser

      public void setUser(String _user)

    • setPassword

      public void setPassword(String _password)

    • setColumnOrder

      public void setColumnOrder(String _value)
      Controls the order in which columns are returned by operations like SELECT *. The default is "DATA". See the UCanAccess website for details.
      Parameters:
      _value - Valid values for this parameter are: "DATA", or "DISPLAY".
      Since:
      2.0.9

    • setConcatNulls

      public void setConcatNulls(Boolean _value)
      Controls what is returned by concatenations involving null values. This setting affects all concatenation operators (&, +, ||).
      Parameters:
      _value -
      • false (the default): null & 'thing' returns 'thing'
      • true: null & 'thing' returns null
      Since:
      3.0.0

    • setEncrypt

      public void setEncrypt(Boolean _value)
      Encrypts the backing database.
      Parameters:
      _value - Setting this value to true tells UCanAccess to encrypt the HSQLDB backing database.
      Since:
      1.0.4

    • setIgnoreCase

      public void setIgnoreCase(Boolean _value)
      Enables case-insensitive string comparisons.
      Parameters:
      _value - (default = true)

    • setImmediatelyReleaseResources

      public void setImmediatelyReleaseResources(Boolean _value)
      Releases the Access database and shuts down HSQLDB immediately after the Connection is closed.
      Parameters:
      _value - Setting this value to true tells UCanAccess to close the Access database file, shut down HSQLDB, and release all related resources (e.g., memory or disk space) as soon as the Connection is closed. Otherwise, UCanAccess will "hold on" to those resources for the setInactivityTimeout(Integer) in case the Access database gets re-opened.

    • setInactivityTimeout

      public void setInactivityTimeout(Integer _value)
      For an in-memory backing database (memory=true), this parameter controls the time (in minutes, default=2), that HSQLDB remains active and the in-memory database remains available after the last connection is closed.
      Parameters:
      _value - (in minutes)
      Since:
      0.1.1

    • setJackcessOpener

      public void setJackcessOpener(String _value)
      Specifies the name of the custom class to be used by Jackcess when opening the Access database. Mainly for use with Jackcess Encrypt to open encrypted databases. See the UCanAccess website for details.
      Parameters:
      _value - name of custom class
      Since:
      0.0.2

    • setKeepMirror

      public void setKeepMirror(String _value)
      Specifies the path where a persistent copy of the HSQLDB backing database files should be stored. Implies memory=false. See the UCanAccess website for details.
      Parameters:
      _value - path
      Since:
      2.0.2

    • setLobScale

      public void setLobScale(Integer _value)
      Controls the allocation unit size for "OLE Object" (i.e., BLOB) data in the HSQLDB backing database. See the UCanAccess website for details.
      Parameters:
      _value - Values allowed are 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, or 32 (the unit is kB). Default is 2 if memory=true, and 32 (the HSQLDB default) otherwise.
      Since:
      2.0.9.4

    • setLoginTimeout

      public void setLoginTimeout(int _value)
      Specified by:
      setLoginTimeout in interface CommonDataSource
      Specified by:
      setLoginTimeout in interface DataSource

    • setLogWriter

      public void setLogWriter(PrintWriter _logWriter)
      Specified by:
      setLogWriter in interface CommonDataSource
      Specified by:
      setLogWriter in interface DataSource

    • setMemory

      public void setMemory(Boolean _value)
      Controls whether the HSQLDB backing database is created in memory (the default) or on disk.
      Parameters:
      _value - Create the backing database in memory (value=true, the default) or on disk (value=false). Creating the backing database on disk will be slower, but it can greatly reduce JVM memory usage.

    • setMirrorFolder

      public void setMirrorFolder(String _value)
      Specifies the path where the temporary HSQLDB backing database files should be stored. Implies memory=false. To create a persistent copy of the backing database, use setKeepMirror(String) instead. See the UCanAccess website for details.
      Parameters:
      _value - value
      Since:
      2.0.9.3

    • setNewDatabaseVersion

      public void setNewDatabaseVersion(String _version)
      Creates a new, empty Access database in the specified format if the database specified by setAccessPath(String) does not exist.
      Parameters:
      _version - database versions, valid values are defined in enum AccessVersion ("V2000", "V2003", "V2007" etc.).

    • setNewDatabaseVersion

      public void setNewDatabaseVersion(AccessVersion _version)

    • setOpenExclusive

      public void setOpenExclusive(Boolean _value)
      Opens the Access database in "exclusive" mode.
      Parameters:
      _value - Setting this value to true tells UCanAccess to open the Access database as "exclusive" (preventing other processes from opening it at the same time).

    • setPreventReloading

      public void setPreventReloading(Boolean _value)
      Prevents unnecessary re-loading of backing database under very specific circumstances.
      USE WITH CAUTION! See the UCanAccess website for details.
      Parameters:
      _value - Setting this value to true prevents UCanAccess from unnecessarily re-loading the backing database under very specific circumstances.
      Since:
      3.0.0

    • setReMap

      public void setReMap(String _value)
      For this connection, temporarily re-directs linked tables in the Access database to point to a different Access database. See the UCanAccess website for details.
      Parameters:
      _value - value
      Since:
      2.0.2

    • setShowSchema

      public void setShowSchema(Boolean _value)
      Exposes the HSQLDB catalog and schema names (e.g., "PUBLIC") in DatabaseMetadata.
      Parameters:
      _value - (default = false)

    • setSkipIndexes

      public void setSkipIndexes(Boolean _value)
      Reduces memory consumption by not creating simple indexes in the backing database.
      Parameters:
      _value - Setting this value to true tells UCanAccess to skip the creation of simple indexes (not associated with a constraint). It doesn't have an effect on referential integrity constraints (i.e., Index Unique, Foreign Key or Primary Key).
      Since:
      2.0.9.4

    • setSysSchema

      public void setSysSchema(Boolean _value)
      Exposes the Access system tables in a read-only schema named "SYS".
      Parameters:
      _value - (default = false)

    • unwrap

      public <T> T unwrap(Class<T> _iface)
      Specified by:
      unwrap in interface Wrapper
